# Confidence Intervals

## Motivating Example


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](15b_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=960}
:::
:::


## Motivating Example


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](15b_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=960}
:::
:::


## Linear Models


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
res <- penguins %>% lm(body_mass_kg ~ species, data = .)
res
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
#> 
#> Call:
#> lm(formula = body_mass_kg ~ species, data = .)
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#>      (Intercept)  speciesChinstrap     speciesGentoo  
#>          3.70616           0.02692           1.38627
```


:::
:::


## Computing the mean

$$
\hat Y = 3.71 + 0.03 \times Chinstrap + 1.39 \times Gentoo 
$$

-   Adelie

-   Chinstrap

-   Gentoo

## Confidence Interval

These are a collection of $\beta_1$ values that will fail to reject the Null Hypothesis.

::: fragment
The $\beta_1$ values that are not different from our current estimate $b_1$
:::

## Confidence Interval

These are a collection of specific parameters that will fail to reject the null hypothesis.

-   Adelie: $\mu_a$

-   Chinstrap: $\mu_c$

-   Gentoo: $\mu_g$

## Looking at Adelie


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](15b_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=960}
:::
:::


## Boostrap CI


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
extract_mean <- function(x){
means <- favstats(body_mass_kg ~ species, data = penguins) %>% 
  select(species, mean) %>%
  t() %>% .[2,] |> as.numeric() 
return(tibble(adelie = means[1], 
                chinstrap = means[2], 
                gentoo = means[3]))
}
boot_means <- do(1000) * extract_mean(resample(penguins))
print("Adelie")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
#> [1] "Adelie"
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
quantile(boot_means$adelie, probs = c(.025, .975))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
#>     2.5%    97.5% 
#> 3.706164 3.706164
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
print("Chinstrap")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
#> [1] "Chinstrap"
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
quantile(boot_means$chinstrap, probs = c(.025, .975))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
#>     2.5%    97.5% 
#> 3.733088 3.733088
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
print("Gentoo")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
#> [1] "Gentoo"
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
quantile(boot_means$gentoo, probs = c(.025, .975))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
#>     2.5%    97.5% 
#> 5.092437 5.092437
```


:::
:::


## Mathematical Models

Use the `pairwise()` to compute confidence intervals.

A difference occurs when 0 is not within the intervals.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
res %>% pairwise()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
#> 
#> 
#>   group_1   group_2    diff pooled_se      q    df  lower upper p_adj
#>   <chr>     <chr>     <dbl>     <dbl>  <dbl> <int>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1 Chinstrap Adelie    0.027     0.048  0.563   330 -0.132 0.186 .9164
#> 2 Gentoo    Adelie    1.386     0.040 34.450   330  1.252 1.520 .0000
#> 3 Gentoo    Chinstrap 1.359     0.050 27.444   330  1.194 1.524 .0000
```


:::
:::


## Plots


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
res %>% pairwise(plot = T)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](15b_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=960}
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
#> 
#> 
#>   group_1   group_2    diff pooled_se      q    df  lower upper p_adj
#>   <chr>     <chr>     <dbl>     <dbl>  <dbl> <int>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1 Chinstrap Adelie    0.027     0.048  0.563   330 -0.132 0.186 .9164
#> 2 Gentoo    Adelie    1.386     0.040 34.450   330  1.252 1.520 .0000
#> 3 Gentoo    Chinstrap 1.359     0.050 27.444   330  1.194 1.524 .0000
```


:::
:::

<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
